unnormalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey Through Ayurveda
normalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey Through Ayurveda

unnormalised: The relentless Mumbai monsoon had left me feeling depleted, like a soggy samosa nobody wanted. My energy was flagging, stress was a constant companion, and sleep…well, sleep was a distant memory. Doctor Sharma at our local clinic simply prescribed more anti-anxiety meds. I knew there had to be a better way. That’s when I started exploring Ayurveda.
normalised: The relentless Mumbai monsoon had left me feeling depleted, like a soggy samosa nobody wanted. My energy was flagging, stress was a constant companion, and sleep…well, sleep was a distant memory. Doctor Sharma at our local clinic simply prescribed more anti-anxiety meds. I knew there had to be a better way. That’s when I started exploring Ayurveda.

unnormalised: My Nani, bless her soul, had always sworn by Ayurvedic remedies. I remembered her making me a turmeric milk concoction whenever I felt even slightly under the weather. Maybe there was something to it. So, I booked myself a consultation at the Kerala Ayurveda Kendra in Andheri. The doctor, Vaidya Iyer, spent a good 45 minutes asking about my lifestyle, diet, and even my emotional state. It wasn’t just about treating symptoms; it was about understanding the root cause. He determined I was heavily *Pitta* imbalanced.
normalised: My Nani, bless her soul, had always sworn by Ayurvedic remedies. I remembered her making me a turmeric milk concoction whenever I felt even slightly under the weather. Maybe there was something to it. So, I booked myself a consultation at the Kerala Ayurveda Kendra in Andheri. The doctor, Vaidya Iyer, spent a good forty five minutes asking about my lifestyle, diet, and even my emotional state. It wasn’t just about treating symptoms; it was about understanding the root cause. He determined I was heavily *Pitta* imbalanced.

unnormalised: He prescribed a customized panchakarma detox program, starting with Abhyanga – a warm oil massage. Honestly, after just one session on 23/07/2024, I felt more relaxed than I had in months. The herbal oils, the gentle pressure… it was pure bliss! The program also included Shirodhara, where warm oil is poured onto your forehead – I was initially skeptical, but at 09:00 hrs sharp each morning, I found myself drifting into a meditative state.
normalised: He prescribed a customized panchakarma detox program, starting with Abhyanga – a warm oil massage. Honestly, after just one session on the twenty third july two thousand and twenty four, I felt more relaxed than I had in months. The herbal oils, the gentle pressure… it was pure bliss! The program also included Shirodhara, where warm oil is poured onto your forehead – I was initially skeptical, but at nine a m sharp each morning, I found myself drifting into a meditative state.

unnormalised: The biggest challenge was adapting my diet. No more spicy vada pav for a while! Vaidya Iyer suggested a cooling diet rich in leafy greens and sweet fruits. Initially, I craved my usual masala chai, but after a week, I started to notice a difference. My digestion improved, my skin glowed, and I felt lighter, both physically and mentally. Even my sleep improved; I was finally getting a solid 7 hours, waking up refreshed at 06:00 hrs.

unnormalised: It's been three months since I started my Ayurvedic journey. I still have a long way to go, but I feel like I'm finally on the right path. This Diwali, on 31/10/2024, I plan to celebrate with a traditional, Ayurvedic-inspired feast! It’s not just about finding cures; it’s about creating a lifestyle that supports balance and well-being. And honestly, after years of relying on quick fixes, that feels incredibly empowering.
